Text.Value: Now that the monster's dead, might it wear off...? You, begone - I must think.

EditorData.NodeContext: The first bit said to themselves, then back to player with "Are you still here..."

Text.Value: Home to Menzoberranzan, once I've caught my breath.
Leave.
No more chatter.
I will free the others. And we will return home.
What did Xargrim and Dhourn fight about?
Did you pick a fight with that spectator?

EditorData.logicalname: Wizard and all other drow dead

Text.Value: An unusual spectator at that, adept at petrification. I was... unprepared.

EditorData.logicalname: Wizard is Dead, Some Drow Petrified

Text.Value: Where will you go from here?
Half-breed you might be, but my thanks are yours.
Fleshcarver grant you your enemies' blood and the wealth of their houses.
Your spirit is mighty, and your will strong. Let these words alone be my thanks.
Dhourn!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Coming to life to see his leader petrified, crying out.

Text.Value: I hardly paid notice. There was talk of a pact - and a forge, as I recall.
A word of thanks would not be out of order.
A man called Xargrim stepped from the shadows. They argued until their words turned to screams. Xargrim summoned the spectator - and fled.
Gh'rack! There's no time to waste. You must free Dhourn.
We will gather our wits and return to Menzoberranzan.
Gh'rack! A pity Dhourn cannot say the same.
You have my thanks. That will suffice.

EditorData.logicalname: Wizard is Dead, No Drow Petrified

Text.Value: I came here with the wizard Dhourn. He vowed to share his fortunes in exchange for protection.
Must I repeat myself? Release Dhourn!
You still breathe after taking that tone. Let that be your thanks.
Hardly.
Ol zhah xunor, t'yin. Flesh once more.

Synopsis:
This drow was petrified by a spectator.
Now he is unpetrified.
Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.
Leave after a long rest.
